FINANCE CUSTOMER CARE REP LEAD

SUMMARY

Property Manager with vast experience in real estate management.
Strengths include sales skills, critical thinking and the ability to communicate with individuals at all levels.

Microsoft Office 2010 Microsoft Project 2007 Sage Timberline Accounting Yardi Voyager Microsoft Office 2010 Suite Sage Timberline Office Yardi Voyager Payroll expertise
Fair housing mandates Knowledge of leasing and market conditions Multi-family property management Strong organizational skills Sharp problem solver Training manual contributor Dedicated to process improvement

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Developed annual budgets, including determining short and long-term goals to support the overall profit and growth objectives.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Financial Analyst II (Hybrid)

Location: Alpharetta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
About The Business

LexisNexis® Risk Solutions provides customers with solutions and decision tools that combine public and industry specific content with advanced technology and analytics to assist them in evaluating and predicting risk and enhancing operational efficiency. We use the power of data and advanced analytics to help our customers make better, timelier decisions. By bringing clarity to information, we ultimately help make communities safer, insurance rates more accurate, commerce more transparent, business decisions easier and processes more efficient. You can learn more about LexisNexis Risk at the link below, https://risk.lexisnexis.com/

About Our Team

The Decision Support team develops, supports and consolidates month-end close activities, prepares, and analyzes schedules & reports and understands their impact on the overall financials. Our team collaborates with our finance colleagues as well as our decision support partners to ensure accurate and efficient forecasting along with providing them timely and accurate reporting. The accuracy of our work is dependent on a wide range of parties at various levels of management to include executive leadership within LNRS.

About The Role

This role is focused on the Business Services business unit within LexisNexis Risk Solutions. This individual will support the business through reporting, forecasting, analysis, and communication to management. This role will help coordinate, and give guidance on consolidated reporting for month-end, support in the management of forecast timelines and schedules, and provide ad-hoc analysis. This position requires exceptional communication and curiosity, as well as the ability to meet deadlines in an ever-changing environment.

The person for this role should be local to Alpharetta, GA as the role will be hybrid from that location.

Responsibilities

Coordinating all scheduled reports for Business Services business unit. This includes weekly/ monthly new business sales pipeline and closes report(s), monthly revenue reports and packages, which are viewed by Executive Leadership, quarterly notes and Town-Hall decks, issued by CEO and weekly revenue projections.Preparing P&L metrics, including providing key insights into trendsProviding governance of internal financial systems, specific to the business unitProviding ad-hoc analysisOther duties as assigned by Finance team members

Requirements

Have a Bachelors level education (Finance, Accounting or Other related field)Have 1+ years direct experience in a finance, accounting or other related fieldHave technical proficiencies is ideal not required: MS Office - Excel, Hyperion, Oracle, other financial and analytical systemsHave excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building capabilities with the ability to quickly form working relationships.Have the ability to work well under pressure and looking for new challengesHave exceptional organizational skills and detailed orientedHave clear communication of issues and analysis

Learn more about the LexisNexis Risk team and how we work here

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
